capabilities.text: I am learning to accept an adult washing my hands.
I am learning to accept having my pull up being changed by an adult.
I am learning to try and explore new foods.
I am learning to join in with physical activities.
I am learning to sit on the toilet for the count of 20 (and not put my hands down the toilet).
I am learning to engage with songs that teach routine.
I can take part in physical activities at playtimes e.g. dance club.
I can indicate to an adult when I need to be changed.
I can wash my hands after the toilet, before dinner etc.
I can accept an adult brushing my teeth.
I can sign / give symbols for my needs e.g. hungry, thirsty, unwell.
I can taste, touch and smell new or different foods.
I can wash my own hands and teeth.
I am beginning to understand which foods are healthy.
I can begin to accept help when I am hurt.
I can actively engage on play equipment.
I can complete up to 5 minutes aqua-aerobics in the pool.
I can drink 1 glass of water a day at school.
I eat a variety of foods and snacks at school.
I know that some foods are healthy and some are not.
I drink 3 cups of water at school a day.
I can move independently in the water.
I can participate in physical play in the playground.
I am willing to try new foods.
I can try different food at dinner and snack times.
I can indicate to adults when I am hungry or thirsty.
I can indicate the correct clothing to be worn in different weather.
I can sort a variety of healthy food from unhealthy.
I can use buoyancy aids to help me move about in the water.
I can join in with physical play indoors and outdoors.
I can show when my nose needs wiping or blowing.
I am prepared to try a range of healthy foods.
I can take part in physical exercise without complaining.
I am beginning to move with decreasing reliance on buoyancy aids in the pool.
I am beginning to accept that I need to go to bed at a certain time.
I am able to wear clothing appropriate to the weather or temperature.
I can try healthy foods.
I know that exercise makes my body healthy.
I can clean my teeth.
I can wash my hands without prompting.
I can identify when I feel happy, sad, pleased or cross.
I can follow instructions to bath or shower.
I can select healthy foods.
I can do 10,000 steps per day (using pedometer around school).
I can brush my teeth properly for 2 minutes per day.
I can wash my hands before eating, after visiting the toilet etc.
I can keep myself clean.
I can identify when I feel happy, sad, pleased or cross.
I can distinguish between healthy and unhealthy foods.
I understand the need to get sufficient and regular sleep.
I can identify what will happen to my teeth if I don’t keep them clean.
I can identify what will happen to my skin if I don’t protect it from the sun.
I understand why it is important to keep my body and my clothes clean.
I understand the benefits of physical exercise and am keen to take part.
I am able to eat a healthy lunch (not too many carbs, eat savoury first etc.).
I am able to wash (bath / shower).
I am active at break times and don’t just stand or sit around.
I can drink water at break and lunch without any fuss.
I can make a healthy choice at lunch time and will try new fruit.
I am active at home and play on other things than the computer.
I understand why it is important to be healthy.
I am aware of what I eat and try to have a balanced diet.
I know when I need a drink.
I know when I need to use tissues.
I know to put my hand over my mouth when I am coughing / sneezing.
I am willing to try new healthy foods.
